name: Abyss of Agony
description: Abyss of Agony is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the second Level of the Riverside area.

name: Bottle Grotto
description: Bottle Grotto is the second Dungeon in Link's Awakening. It is the resting place of the Conch Horn, one of the eight Instruments of the Sirens. The entrance to this Dungeon is located within Goponga Swamp, north of the Mysterious Forest and is surrounded by swampy Water fitting with the Dungeon being named a Grotto, which is a cave located near a source of Water and is prone to flooding, although no Water can actually be found within the Dungeon. BowWow is needed to enter, as the entrance is completely blocked by Goponga Flowers, which cannot be destroyed by using any of the weapons Link currently has available to him. The interior of this Dungeon is mostly gray flooring and blue walls. The main tool of the Dungeon is the Power Bracelet, which is required to lift the numerous Pots and the Genie's Bottle which the level is named after. The mini-boss is a Hinox.

name: Bosh Kala Shrine
description: The Bosh Kala Shrine, designated by the Trial name The Wind Guides You, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Bomb Storage
description: Bomb Storage is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the second Level in the Fortress area.

name: Castle Dungeon
description: The Castle Dungeon, also known as the Sewer Passageway, is a dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Blazing Trail
description: Blazing Trail is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the first Level in the Volcano area.

name: Beneath the Well
description: Beneath the Well is a vast maze-like mini-dungeon in Majora's Mask. It is located in Ikana Canyon, and must be traversed in order to obtain the Mirror Shield and be granted entrance to the Ancient Castle of Ikana.

name: Bellum
description: Bellum is the primary antagonist of Phantom Hourglass, and serves as the Final Boss.

name: Black Tower
description: The Black Tower, also known as Ambi's Tower, is a massive tower made of stone featured in Oracle of Ages that was built to the heavens 400 years in Labrynna's past by the order of Queen Ambi. However, after Veran arrived in the past, she manipulated the construction of the project and began using the tower for her own purposes.

name: Buzz Blob Cave
description: Buzz Blob Cave is the second Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the second Level of the Woodlands area, preceded by Deku Forest and followed by Moblin Base.

name: Bridge of Eldin
description: The Bridge of Eldin, also known as Eldin Bridge, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Level 1
description: Level 1, also known as Level-1, and Eagle, is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Secret Fortress
description: Secret Fortress is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the first Level in the Riverside area.

name: Ranch Target Practice
description: Ranch Target Practice is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the first Stage in the Finale.

name: Trial of the Sword
description: The Trial of the Sword, also known as the Sword Monk's Shrine, is a challenge and mini-dungeon in Breath of the Wild added in The Master Trials DLC Pack.

name: Tower of Winds
description: The Tower of Winds is a level that appears in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Thief
description: Thieves are recurring enemies and characters in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: The Swamp
description: The Swamp is the second stage of the Near the Fields level in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Temple of Storms
description: The Temple of Storms is a dungeon in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Temple of Darkness
description: The Temple of Darkness is the third dungeon of The Dark World in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Swamp Palace
description: The Swamp Palace, also known as Level 2, is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Snowpeak Ruins
description: Snowpeak Ruins is the fifth dungeon in Twilight Princess.

name: Stone Corridors
description: Stone Corridors is a Level in Tri Force Heroes. It is the second Level of The Dunes area.

name: The Mountain Path
description: The Mountain Path is the second stage of Death Mountain in Four Swords Adventures. Following the foothills, eventually the Links get onto the mountain path. It is an dry and reeky area, much prone to rockfalls. The longtime guardians of the mountain, the Gorons, reside here as well. Once the four Links arrive, they're told by Kaepora Gaebora to help the Gorons who have been pestered by a giant bird.

name: Skulltula Forest: Ranger
description: Skulltula Forest: Ranger, also known as Level 4-3, is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the third Stage of Level 4.

name: Shrine of Water
description: The Shrine of Water is the fifth dungeon in Zelda's Adventure. It is a flooded cavern on Sea Island, guarded by its Shrine Keeper and boss, Agwanda.

name: Shrine of Air
description: The Shrine of Air is the third dungeon in Zelda's Adventure. It is a crystal palace located in the sky above Tolemac. Its Shrine Keeper and boss is Aviana.

name: Sheem Dagoze Shrine
description: Sheem Dagoze Shrine, designated by the Trial name Moving in Parallel, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shai Utoh Shrine
description: The Shai Utoh Shrine,, designated by the Trial name Halt the Tilt, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shae Katha Shrine
description: The Shae Katha Shrine, designated by the Trial name Shae Katha's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sasa Kai Shrine
description: The Sasa Kai Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Modest Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sah Dahaj Shrine
description: The Sah Dahaj Shrine, designated by the Trial name Power of Fire, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Room of Rites
description: The Room of Rites is a location seen only in a Linked Game of Oracle of Ages or Oracle of Seasons. On an altar within the room stands three torches, where the Flames of Destruction, Sorrow, and Despair are lit. The room is utilized by Twinrova to perform the Dark Rites and resurrect Ganon, the malevolent Evil King, who can be brought back once the three torches are lit and a vessel is presented to be inhabited by Ganon's spirit.

name: Ritaag Zumo Shrine
description: The Ritaag Zumo Shrine, designated by the Trial name RItaag Zumo's blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Pumaag Nitae Shrine
description: The Pumaag Nitae Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Minor Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Pirate Hideaway
description: The Pirate Hideaway is the second dungeon in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland.

name: Owa Daim Shrine
description: The Owa Daim Shrine, designated by the Trial name Stasis Trial, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Zalta Wa Shrine
description: The Zalta Wa Shrine, designated by the Trial name Two Orbs to Guide You, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Woodfall Temple
description: Woodfall Temple is the first Dungeon in Majora's Mask.

name: Oocca Target Practice
description: Oocca Target Practice, also known as Level 5-1, is a Stage in Link's Crossbow Training. It is the first Stage in Level 5.

name: Noe Rajee Shrine
description: Noe Rajee Shrine, designated by the Trial name The Four Winds, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Bottom of the Well
description: The Bottom of the Well is a mini-dungeon in Ocarina of Time. It is located in Kakariko Village, more specifically at the bottom of Kakariko Well, which is also known as the Well of Three Features. It consists of an underground chamber that guards the Lens of Truth. On the whole, this dungeon is optional, having no effect on the main quest if not attempted. However, without the Lens of Truth, places such as the Haunted Wasteland, the Spirit Temple, the Shadow Temple, and Ganon's Castle will be more difficult to navigate. Also, Link may miss out on many treasures hidden throughout Hyrule that only the Lens of Truth can uncover.

name: Level 2
description: Level 2, also stylized as Level-2, and known as Moon, is a recurring Dungeon and Level in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Raqa Zunzo Shrine
description: The Raqa Zunzo Shrine, designated by the Trial name Raqa Zunzo's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Temple of Fire
description: The Temple of Fire is the first Dungeon that Link visits in Phantom Hourglass. It is located on the Isle of Ember. It protects the Spirit of Power.

name: Tho Kayu Shrine
description: The Tho Kayu Shrine, designated by the Trial name Tho Kayu's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Toh Yahsa Shrine
description: The Toh Yahsa Shrine, designated by the Trial name Buried Secrets, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tower of Spirits
description: The Tower of Spirits, also known as the Central Tower, and Tower of the Gods, is a towering fortress that appears as the central dungeon in Spirit Tracks.

name: The Dark Cloud
description: The Dark Cloud is the second stage in the Realm of the Heavens in Four Swords Adventures. The first part of the stage plays in a side-scrolling perspective. After entering a beam of light to get to the next area, it returns to the traditional top-down view.

name: Temple of the Ocean King
description: The Temple of the Ocean King is a Dungeon in Phantom Hourglass.
